titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Feurer Plass (1896-1973) was a 1917 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She married Webster Plass, an electrical engineer who worked as a consultant around the world. Margaret Plass traveled with her husband, and together they collected art, with a particular focus on African art.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence and photograph albums from the Plass's journeys to South America, Africa, Europe, and Asia. In addition there are scrapbooks and photographs documenting the Plasses' collection of African art. There is a small amount of material relating to Plass's time at Bryn Mawr College.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
